output_list.impact: Integer overflow in mintToken function allows the owner to set any user as the new owner of the mintToken function.
The transfer function does not check the caller's identity, allowing attackers to change contract ownership.
The mintToken function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized mint tokens to be created.
The transferFrom function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized transfers to different users.
The approveAndCall function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized increase of the attacker's assets.
The burnFrom function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized burn of user assets.
The mintToken function uses the _random() function, which is susceptible to random salt attacks, allowing unauthorized access to the contract.
The transfer function uses the _random() function, which is susceptible to random salt attacks, allowing unauthorized transfer of assets.
The freezeAccount function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized freeze of user assets.
The freezeAccount function has an integer overflow, allowing unauthorized freeze of user assets.
